Module com.example.navalbattleminiproject3
Package com.example.navalbattleminiproject3.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.example.navalbattleminiproject3.controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
GameController class manages the game's core logic, including players' boards and game mechanics.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(boolean isLoadedMatch, String loadedProfile)
      Initializes the game state with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      isLoadedMatch - true if the game is a loaded match, false otherwise.
      loadedProfile - the profile name of the loaded player.
      See Also:
      • startPlay(boolean, String)

      Parameters:

    • createShip

      public javafx.scene.layout.StackPane createShip(int type, int playerOrBot)
      Creates a ship for either the player or the bot based on the type and owner. Configures the ship's graphical elements and interactions.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the ship, ranging from 1 to 4, determining its size.
      playerOrBot - an integer indicating the owner (1 for player, 2 for bot).
      Returns:
      a StackPane representing the created ship.
      See Also:
      • rotateBoat(StackPane, int)
      • placeBoatInCell(Pane, int, int, GridPane)

    • getPlayerShipType

      public int getPlayerShipType(javafx.scene.layout.Pane ship)
      Retrieves the type of the given ship based on its index in the player's or bot's list.
      Parameters:
      ship - the Pane representing the ship to identify.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the type of the ship, or -1 if not found.

    • rotateBoat

      public void rotateBoat(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane boat, int playerOrBot)
      Rotates a ship by 90 degrees and adjusts its position to maintain alignment. Applies specific translations based on the ship's type and angle.
      Parameters:
      boat - the StackPane representing the ship to rotate.
      playerOrBot - an integer indicating the owner (1 for player, 2 for bot).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ship type is invalid.
      See Also:
      • RotateTransition

    • getShipDirection

      public int getShipDirection(javafx.scene.layout.Pane ship)
      Gets the current direction of the ship based on its rotation angle.
      Parameters:
      ship - the Pane representing the ship.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the direction: 0 (right), 1 (up), 2 (left), 3 (down), or -1 if invalid.

    • createBotTable

      public void createBotTable()
      Creates the bot's game board, initializing its cells and placing the ships.
      See Also:
      • positionBotShipWithDirection(int, int, int)

    • positionBotShipWithDirection

      public void positionBotShipWithDirection(int type, int row, int col)
      Positions a bot's ship on the board at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the ship to position.
      row - the row on the grid where the ship starts.
      col - the column on the grid where the ship starts.
      See Also:
      • getPaneOfShip(int, int)
      • placeBoatInCell(Pane, int, int, GridPane)

      Parameters:
      type - the type of the ship.
      playerOrBot - indicates the owner: 1 for player, 2 for bot.
      Returns:
      the StackPane representing the ship, or null if not found.

      row - the row index of the cell.
      col - the column index of the cell.

    • hoverPlayerBoard

      public void hoverPlayerBoard(int row, int col, int type, int direction, javafx.scene.paint.Color highlightColor)
      Highlights the cells on the player's board based on the ship's type and direction.
      Parameters:
      row - the starting row for highlighting.
      col - the starting column for highlighting.
      type - the type of the ship.
      direction - the direction of the ship.
      highlightColor - the Color to apply as the highlight.
      See Also:
      • getNodeFromGridPane(GridPane, int, int)

    • getNodeFromGridPane

      public javafx.scene.Node getNodeFromGridPane(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, int col, int row)
      Retrieves a specific node from the grid pane based on its row and column indices.
      Parameters:
      gridPane - the GridPane to search.
      col - the column index.
      row - the row index.
      Returns:
      the Node at the specified position, or null if not found.

      public void placeBoatInCell(javafx.scene.layout.Pane ship, int row, int col, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid)

      Parameters:
      ship - the Pane representing the ship.
      row - the row index of the cell.
      col - the column index of the cell.
      grid - the GridPane where the ship will be placed.

    • setVisibleBotPlayerCloud

      public void setVisibleBotPlayerCloud(boolean visible)
      Sets the visibility of the bot and player cloud images.
      Parameters:
      visible - true to make the clouds visible, false otherwise.

    • resetLabelCloudBotPlayer

      public void resetLabelCloudBotPlayer()
      Resets the text of the labels indicating bot and player thoughts.

    • changeTurnToBot

      public void changeTurnToBot()
      Switches the turn to the bot, allowing it to make a move. Verifies game state after each bot action and determines if the game has ended.
      See Also:
      • makeShot(int, int, int)
      • setDisableShotCells()

    • setDisableShotCells

      public void setDisableShotCells()
      Disables cells on the bot's board that have already been targeted. Prevents further interaction with these cells.
      See Also:
      • getNodeFromGridPane(GridPane, int, int)

    • prepareBotBoardForShot

      public void prepareBotBoardForShot()
      Prepares the bot's board for shots, enabling interactions for the player's turn. Configures event handlers for grid cells to manage player actions.
      See Also:
      • handleMouseEnter(Rectangle, int, int)
      • handleMouseExit(Rectangle, int, int)
      • makeShot(int, int, int)

    • disableBotBoard

      public void disableBotBoard(boolean disable)
      Toggles the enabled/disabled state of all cells on the bot's board.
      Parameters:
      disable - true to disable all cells, false to enable them.
      See Also:
      • getNodeFromGridPane(GridPane, int, int)

    • disablePlayerBoard

      public void disablePlayerBoard(boolean disable)
      Toggles the enabled/disabled state of all cells on the player's board.
      Parameters:
      disable - true to disable all cells, false to enable them.
      See Also:
      • getNodeFromGridPane(GridPane, int, int)

    • makeShot

      public void makeShot(int row, int col, int playerOrBot)
      Handles the logic for executing a shot during the game. Updates the game board and visual elements based on the outcome of the shot.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index where the shot is targeted.
      col - the column index where the shot is targeted.
      playerOrBot - 1 if the shot is from the player, 2 if it's from the bot.
      See Also:
      • makeBoatDestroyed(int, int, int)
      • getNodeFromGridPane(GridPane, int, int)

    • makeBoatDestroyed

      public void makeBoatDestroyed(int row, int col, int playerOrBot)
      Marks the specified boat as destroyed, updating its visual representation on the board. Iterates through the boat's cells to reflect its destruction with a visual effect.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index of the boat.
      col - the column index of the boat.
      playerOrBot - 1 for player, 2 for bot.
      Throws:
      GameException.OutOfBoardAction - if an invalid action occurs on the board.
      See Also:
      • getNodeFromGridPane(GridPane, int, int)

    • handleWatchBotBoard

      public void handleWatchBotBoard(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Toggles the visibility of the bot's board based on a user action. Enables or disables the visibility of bot ships to simulate "watch mode."
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent triggered by the user.
      See Also:
      • usedBotPaneShip

    • win

      public void win(int playerOrBot)
      Ends the game, declaring a winner and resetting the game state. Displays an alert with the results and updates the player profile accordingly.
      Parameters:
      playerOrBot - 1 if the player wins, 2 if the bot wins.
      See Also:
      • Alert
      • PlayerBoard.restartGame()
      • BotBoard.restartGame()

    • loadPlayerTable

      public void loadPlayerTable()
      Creates the player's game board from the loaded match data. Positions all ships and sets up the initial state of the board.
      See Also:
      • positionPlayerShipsWithDirection(int, int, int)

    • positionPlayerShipsWithDirection

      public void positionPlayerShipsWithDirection(int type, int row, int col)
      Positions the player's ships on the board based on their type and direction. Adjusts the ships' orientation and ensures proper placement on the grid.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the ship.
      row - the starting row index for the ship.
      col - the starting column index for the ship.
      See Also:
      • rotateBoat(StackPane, int)
      • placeBoatInCell(Pane, int, int, GridPane)

    • cleanLoadedBoards

      public List<List<Integer>> cleanLoadedBoards(List<List<Integer>> board)
      Cleans the board by resetting negative or invalid values to their default state.
      Parameters:
      board - the board to clean, represented as a list of lists.
      Returns:
      the cleaned board.

    • loadShootsOnBoard

      public void loadShootsOnBoard(int playerOrBot, List<List<Integer>> shootedReferenceboard)
      Loads and applies the recorded shots from a saved game on the specified board. Updates the board with visual indicators of the shots taken.
      Parameters:
      playerOrBot - 1 for player, 2 for bot.
      shootedReferenceboard - the reference board with shot records.
      See Also:
      • makeShot(int, int, int)

    • loadingMatch

      public void loadingMatch(String loadedProfile)
      Loads a saved match, reconstructing the board states and game configurations. Positions ships and applies any saved shots on the respective boards.
      Parameters:
      loadedProfile - the profile of the player whose match is being loaded.
      See Also:
      • cleanLoadedBoards(List)
      • loadPlayerTable()

    • startPlay

      public void startPlay(boolean isLoadedMatch, String loadedProfile)
      Starts a new game or resumes a loaded match. Initializes the player and bot boards and sets up the game state.
      Parameters:
      isLoadedMatch - true if resuming a saved match, false for a new game.
      loadedProfile - the profile name of the player.
      See Also:
      • loadingMatch(String)
      • createBoardShips()
